component.name: mllp
component.title: MLLP
component.description: Communicate with external systems using the MLLP protocol.
component.label: networking,rpc,mllp

autoAck.description: Enable/Disable the automatic generation of a MLLP Acknowledgement MLLP Consumers only

charsetName.description: Sets the default charset to use

configuration.description: Sets the default configuration to use when creating MLLP endpoints.

hl7Headers.description: Enable/Disable the automatic generation of message headers from the HL7 Message MLLP Consumers only

requireEndOfData.description: Enable/Disable strict compliance to the MLLP standard. The MLLP standard specifies START_OF_BLOCKhl7 payloadEND_OF_BLOCKEND_OF_DATA, however, some systems do not send the final END_OF_DATA byte. This setting controls whether or not the final END_OF_DATA byte is required or optional.

stringPayload.description: Enable/Disable converting the payload to a String. If enabled, HL7 Payloads received from external systems will be validated converted to a String. If the charsetName property is set, that character set will be used for the conversion. If the charsetName property is not set, the value of MSH-18 will be used to determine th appropriate character set. If MSH-18 is not set, then the default ISO-8859-1 character set will be use.

validatePayload.description: Enable/Disable the validation of HL7 Payloads If enabled, HL7 Payloads received from external systems will be validated (see Hl7Util.generateInvalidPayloadExceptionMessage for details on the validation). If and invalid payload is detected, a MllpInvalidMessageException (for consumers) or a MllpInvalidAcknowledgementException will be thrown.

acceptTimeout.label: advanced,consumer
acceptTimeout.description: Timeout (in milliseconds) while waiting for a TCP connection TCP Server Only

backlog.label: advanced,consumer
backlog.description: The maximum queue length for incoming connection indications (a request to connect) is set to the backlog parameter. If a connection indication arrives when the queue is full, the connection is refused.

bindRetryInterval.label: advanced,consumer
bindRetryInterval.description: TCP Server Only - The number of milliseconds to wait between bind attempts

bindTimeout.label: advanced,consumer
bindTimeout.description: TCP Server Only - The number of milliseconds to retry binding to a server port

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to receive incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. If disabled, the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions by logging them at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

lenientBind.label: advanced,consumer
lenientBind.description: TCP Server Only - Allow the endpoint to start before the TCP ServerSocket is bound. In some environments, it may be desirable to allow the endpoint to start before the TCP ServerSocket is bound.

maxConcurrentConsumers.label: advanced,consumer
maxConcurrentConsumers.description: The maximum number of concurrent MLLP Consumer connections that will be allowed. If a new connection is received and the maximum is number are already established, the new connection will be reset immediately.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

connectTimeout.label: advanced,producer
connectTimeout.description: Timeout (in milliseconds) for establishing for a TCP connection TCP Client only

idleTimeoutStrategy.label: advanced,producer
idleTimeoutStrategy.description: decide what action to take when idle timeout occurs. Possible values are : RESET: set SO_LINGER to 0 and reset the socket CLOSE: close the socket gracefully default is RESET.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

defaultCharset.label: advanced
defaultCharset.description: Set the default character set to use for byte to/from String conversions.

logPhiMaxBytes.label: advanced
logPhiMaxBytes.description: Set the maximum number of bytes of PHI that will be logged in a log entry.

maxBufferSize.label: advanced
maxBufferSize.description: Maximum buffer size used when receiving or sending data over the wire.

minBufferSize.label: advanced
minBufferSize.description: Minimum buffer size used when receiving or sending data over the wire.

readTimeout.label: advanced
readTimeout.description: The SO_TIMEOUT value (in milliseconds) used after the start of an MLLP frame has been received

receiveBufferSize.label: advanced
receiveBufferSize.description: Sets the SO_RCVBUF option to the specified value (in bytes)

receiveTimeout.label: advanced
receiveTimeout.description: The SO_TIMEOUT value (in milliseconds) used when waiting for the start of an MLLP frame

sendBufferSize.label: advanced
sendBufferSize.description: Sets the SO_SNDBUF option to the specified value (in bytes)

idleTimeout.label: advanced,tcp
idleTimeout.description: The approximate idle time allowed before the Client TCP Connection will be reset. A null value or a value less than or equal to zero will disable the idle timeout.

CamelMllpLocalAddress.description: The local TCP Address of the Socket

CamelMllpRemoteAddress.description: The remote TCP Address of the Socket

CamelMllpAcknowledgement.description: The HL7 Acknowledgment received in bytes

CamelMllpAcknowledgementString.description: The HL7 Acknowledgment received, converted to a String

CamelMllpAcknowledgementType.description: The HL7 acknowledgement type (AA, AE, AR, etc)

hostname.description: Hostname or IP for connection for the TCP connection. The default value is null, which means any local IP address

port.description: Port number for the TCP connection

autoAck.description: Enable/Disable the automatic generation of a MLLP Acknowledgement MLLP Consumers only

charsetName.description: Sets the default charset to use

hl7Headers.description: Enable/Disable the automatic generation of message headers from the HL7 Message MLLP Consumers only

requireEndOfData.description: Enable/Disable strict compliance to the MLLP standard. The MLLP standard specifies START_OF_BLOCKhl7 payloadEND_OF_BLOCKEND_OF_DATA, however, some systems do not send the final END_OF_DATA byte. This setting controls whether or not the final END_OF_DATA byte is required or optional.

stringPayload.description: Enable/Disable converting the payload to a String. If enabled, HL7 Payloads received from external systems will be validated converted to a String. If the charsetName property is set, that character set will be used for the conversion. If the charsetName property is not set, the value of MSH-18 will be used to determine th appropriate character set. If MSH-18 is not set, then the default ISO-8859-1 character set will be use.

validatePayload.description: Enable/Disable the validation of HL7 Payloads If enabled, HL7 Payloads received from external systems will be validated (see Hl7Util.generateInvalidPayloadExceptionMessage for details on the validation). If and invalid payload is detected, a MllpInvalidMessageException (for consumers) or a MllpInvalidAcknowledgementException will be thrown.

acceptTimeout.label: advanced,consumer
acceptTimeout.description: Timeout (in milliseconds) while waiting for a TCP connection TCP Server Only

backlog.label: advanced,consumer
backlog.description: The maximum queue length for incoming connection indications (a request to connect) is set to the backlog parameter. If a connection indication arrives when the queue is full, the connection is refused.

bindRetryInterval.label: advanced,consumer
bindRetryInterval.description: TCP Server Only - The number of milliseconds to wait between bind attempts

bindTimeout.label: advanced,consumer
bindTimeout.description: TCP Server Only - The number of milliseconds to retry binding to a server port

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to receive incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. If disabled, the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions by logging them at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

lenientBind.label: advanced,consumer
lenientBind.description: TCP Server Only - Allow the endpoint to start before the TCP ServerSocket is bound. In some environments, it may be desirable to allow the endpoint to start before the TCP ServerSocket is bound.

maxConcurrentConsumers.label: advanced,consumer
maxConcurrentConsumers.description: The maximum number of concurrent MLLP Consumer connections that will be allowed. If a new connection is received and the maximum is number are already established, the new connection will be reset immediately.

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

connectTimeout.label: advanced,producer
connectTimeout.description: Timeout (in milliseconds) for establishing for a TCP connection TCP Client only

idleTimeoutStrategy.label: advanced,producer
idleTimeoutStrategy.description: decide what action to take when idle timeout occurs. Possible values are : RESET: set SO_LINGER to 0 and reset the socket CLOSE: close the socket gracefully default is RESET.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer,advanced
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

maxBufferSize.label: advanced
maxBufferSize.description: Maximum buffer size used when receiving or sending data over the wire.

minBufferSize.label: advanced
minBufferSize.description: Minimum buffer size used when receiving or sending data over the wire.

readTimeout.label: advanced
readTimeout.description: The SO_TIMEOUT value (in milliseconds) used after the start of an MLLP frame has been received

receiveBufferSize.label: advanced
receiveBufferSize.description: Sets the SO_RCVBUF option to the specified value (in bytes)

receiveTimeout.label: advanced
receiveTimeout.description: The SO_TIMEOUT value (in milliseconds) used when waiting for the start of an MLLP frame

sendBufferSize.label: advanced
sendBufferSize.description: Sets the SO_SNDBUF option to the specified value (in bytes)

idleTimeout.label: advanced,tcp
idleTimeout.description: The approximate idle time allowed before the Client TCP Connection will be reset. A null value or a value less than or equal to zero will disable the idle timeout.
